name: Supplemental Disaster Relief Program
objective: SDRP provides financial assistance to eligible producers for losses to crops, trees, bushes, and vines due to wildfires, hurricanes, floods, derechos, excessive heat, winter storms, freeze (including a polar vortex), smoke exposure, excessive moisture, tornadoes, qualifying drought, and related conditions that occurred in calendar years 2023 and 2024.
applicant_types: Native American Organizations (includes Indian groups, cooperatives, corporations, partnerships, associations)
Private nonprofit institution/organization (includes institutions of higher education and hospitals)

authorizations.text: The American Relief Act, 2025, Division B, Title 1.

rules_regulations: SDRP will be administered as provided in the Final Rule published in the Federal Register and the regulations in 7 CFR part 760, subpart V. The procedural handbook is available on FSA’s website and from county FSA offices.
